data.title: Darwin's+radio by Greg+bear
data.meta_description: La radio de Darwin (BEST SELLER ZETA BOLSILLO) by Bear, Greg and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First edition first printing. Hardback book is tight and clean with a hint of lean. Boards sharp and clean, title gilt perfect. Text block clean, with toning to edges, slightly shaken at head of spine due to weight of text block. The pages are crisp and unblemished. Feels lightly read. Sharp spine ends, very good condition. Jacket some minor crimping to top edge. Light handling marks to the gloss. For grading accuracy books are photographed without a protective book cover. This book is fitted with a non adhesive archival quality book protector to make a worthy addition to your collection. Note we do not use stock images, the book pictured is the book described. A very good copy of this collectible first edition first printing title.

Paperback (VG); all our specials have minimal description to keep listing them viable. They are at least reading copies, complete and in reasonable condition, but usually secondhand; frequently they are superior examples. Ordering more than one book will reduce your overall postage cost.

Paperback (nr fine); all our specials have minimal description to keep listing them viable. They are at least reading copies, complete and in reasonable condition, but usually secondhand; frequently they are superior examples.Ordering more than one book will reduce your overall postage cost.

paperback (VG+); all our specials have minimal description to keep listing them viable. They are at least reading copies, complete and in reasonable condition, but usually secondhand; frequently they are superior examples.Ordering more than one book will reduce your overall postage cost.

Condition: Good. SHIPS FROM USA. Used books have different signs of use and do not include supplemental materials such as CDs, Dvds, Access Codes, charts or any other extra material. All used books might have various degrees of writing, highliting and wear and tear and possibly be an ex-library with the usual stickers and stamps. Dust Jackets are not guaranteed and when still present, they will have various degrees of tear and damage. All images are Stock Photos, not of the actual item. book.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. FIne, unread, SIGNED, first edition. Dust jackets has light dust staining on left front cover, foxing on top page block. Otherwise, book is in fine shape. All book jackets in mylar wraps. Signed by Author(s).

Paperback. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. Uncorrected proof. SIGNED by the author. Minor shelf and handling wear, overall a clean solid copy with minimal signs of use. *** Signed by author, Greg Bear *** Secure packaging for safe delivery. 1.01. signed by author.

Hardcover first edition - First printing. A cutting edge thriller that questions everything we believe about evolution. Winner of the Nebula Award. 430 pp. Very near fine in a like dustjacket.

Condition: As New. Signed Copy First edition copy. . Very Good dust jacket. Signed by author on customized label on title page. Review copy with reviewer's news release and review copy card laid in. From the library of science fiction and fantasy writer, editor, publisher and prolific book reviewer D. Douglas Fratz. (science fiction, evolution, genetics).

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. First edition , first printing , NY. 1971. A fine book in the original binding. Crisp and clean. In a fine dust jacket with no wear. As new.

Hardcover. First edition (& 1st printing). SF novel. Preceded the US edition by several weeks: winner of the 2001 Nebula Award for best novel. Fine copy in an almost fine dustjacket.
